summary: This document is an email chain from late January 2020 between law enforcement officials (FBI, NYPD, SDNY prosecutors) and attorney Jill Greenfield regarding scheduling a call to discuss her client, who is a victim of sexual assault in the UK and a potential witness/interviewee in the Epstein investigation. The correspondence highlights coordination for an interview in London and the client's legal protections.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.context: She is the attorney representing a client who is a victim of sexual assault in the UK and is coordinating with U.S. law enforcement regarding a potential interview in London for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial contact from attorney Jill Greenfield
events.description: Attorney Jill Greenfield emails law enforcement regarding her client, a victim of sexual assault in the UK, and the possibility of an interview in London, noting her client's right to anonymity.

events.title: Follow-up on scheduling call
events.description: Law enforcement follows up with Jill Greenfield after missing a scheduling window, attempting to set up a call for Friday, January 31.

events.title: Final follow-up on lack of response
events.description: An email is sent noting that Jill Greenfield did not respond to emails earlier in the week after initial contact, asking someone to reach out to her on Monday.

keyFacts: The email chain involves coordination between U.S. law enforcement (FBI, NYPD, SDNY prosecutors) and UK attorney Jill Greenfield regarding interviewing her client in the Epstein investigation.
Jill Greenfield's client is identified as a victim of sexual assault that occurred in the United Kingdom and is entitled to automatic anonymity under UK statute, which she does not waive.
The purpose of the proposed call is to discuss the parameters of law enforcement's interest in the client and to provide background information.
The correspondence shows active investigation efforts into Epstein's network extending to the UK in January 2020, months after Epstein's death.
Multiple law enforcement entities are involved: FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force, NYPD, and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York.
